all_questions.question: What was the outcome of applying a similar tokenization to the reference and MT output in an experiment?
all_questions.context: me a better improvement and then also I applied a similar tokenization to the reference and my MT output

all_questions.question: What is the main conclusion drawn from this experiment regarding the impact of tokenization on BLEU scores?
all_questions.context: the impression was that complicated methods bring more

all_questions.question: Why is it emphasized to run the same processing pipeline on outputs when comparing systems?
all_questions.context: You cannot copy numbers from any paper because you don't know what type of tokenization they use and all that.

all_questions.question: What was the specific improvement in BLEU score reported as a result of the experiment?
all_questions.context: So obviously this just highlights that I was very young and stupid and I didn't know that the tokenization absolutely has to match

all_questions.question: What insight is gained from recognizing that huge jumps in BLEU scores are due to superficial properties?
all_questions.context: And for this reason, it is absolutely critical that when you are comparing your system with other systems, that you get the outputs
